intro: Pilosella megargyrocoma, commonly known as the narrowleaf pilosella, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and leaves that are narrow and linear, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pilosella megargyrocoma is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates.
